required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of HIV-1 and Aging on Mucosal Vaccine Responses
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of HIV-1 and Aging on Mucosal Vaccine Responses

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Eastern Colorado Health Care System

clinical_study.source: VA Eastern Colorado Health Care System

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to learn more about both HIV-1 infection and advancing age, alone and in combination, and their association with increased risk of serious infection and impaired response to the Prevnar 13 vaccine.

primary_outcome.measure: Determine pneumococcal specific IgG levels in BAL (BronchoAlveolar Lavage) fluid and NPF (Nasopharyngeal Fluid)
primary_outcome.time_frame: A change from baseline, measured at pre-vaccination, and 1 month post vaccine
primary_outcome.description: Determine pneumococcal specific IgG levels in BAL fluid and NPF and to standardize the results we will compare it to the total levels in the BAL/NPF fluid collected at all timepoints

primary_outcome.measure: Determine pneumococcal specific IgG levels in serum
primary_outcome.time_frame: A change from baseline, measured at pre-vaccination, and 1 month post vaccine
primary_outcome.description: Determine pneumococcal specific IgG levels in serum 1 month post vaccination response criteria must meet >2-fold rise with a post-vaccination level >1000 ng/ml for > 7 of the 12 serotypes

arm_group.description: One time administration of Prevnar-13 vaccine to HIV+ participants
One time administration of Prevnar-13 vaccine to HIV Negative Control participants

intervention.description: One time administration of prevnar-13 vaccine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Veterans only (accessibility to non-veterans pending)
- Age 21-45 or 55-75 Years Old
- Have not received pneumococcal vaccine Prevnar PCV-13
- Able to attend 2-3 study visits over 1 month
HIV+:
-Undetectable Viral load
HIV negative controls:
-no history or risks for HIV infection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Spleen removed
- Chronic Kidney disease (creatinine â‰¥ 2.0 mg/dL)
- Lymphoma or leukemia
- Currently taking: Corticosteroids (prednisone, medrol, etc), Chemotherapy, Immunosuppressive medication (cyclosporine, methotrexate, azathioprine, infliximab, adalimumab, rituximab, etanercept, etc), or illicit drugs (methamphetamine, cocaine, crack, or heroin)

facility.name: Rocky Mountain Regional VA Medical Center
